intro: Palala venosa, commonly known as the veined palala, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, veined leaves that range in color from deep green to almost black. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals and prominent stamens. Palala venosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
